chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
y: nat
x: nat

Goal:
x ≲ y -> x <= y

Premises:
nat_rev_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P (S n) -> P n) -> forall x y : nat, x <= y -> P y -> P x
binary_le_refl : forall x : nat, x ≲ x
Init.Nat.div = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => fst (divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div (_ _)%nat_scope
measure_rect : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> nat) (P : X -> Type), (forall x : X, (forall y : X, m y < m x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall x : X, P x
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
Nat.compare_nge_iff : forall x y : nat, (x ?= y) = Lt < -> ~ y <= x
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => y | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
BinPosDef.Pos.to_nat = fun x : BinNums.positive => BinPosDef.Pos.iter_op add x 1 : BinNums.positive -> nat Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.to_nat _%positive_scope : simpl never
Nat.leb_spec0 : forall x y : nat, reflect (x <= y) (x <=? y)
min_dec : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, {P n} + {~ P n}) -> (exists n : nat, P n) -> {m : nat | P m /\ (forall x : nat, P x -> m <= x)}
Nat.leb_spec : forall x y : nat, BoolSpec (x <= y) (y < x) (x <=? y)
BinIntDef.Z.compare = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => Eq | BinNums.Zpos _ => Lt | BinNums.Zneg _ => Gt end | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinPos.Pos.compare x' y' | _ => Gt end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Zneg y' => CompOpp (BinPos.Pos.compare x' y') | _ => Lt end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> comparison Arguments BinIntDef.Z.compare (_ _)%Z_scope
QArith_base.Qlt = fun x y : QArith_base.Q => BinInt.Z.lt (BinInt.Z.mul (QArith_base.Qnum x) (BinNums.Zpos (QArith_base.Qden y))) (BinInt.Z.mul (QArith_base.Qnum y) (BinNums.Zpos (QArith_base.Qden x))) : QArith_base.Q -> QArith_base.Q -> Prop Arguments QArith_base.Qlt (_ _)%Q_scope
BinPosDef.Pos.mul = fix mul (x y : BinNums.positive) {struct x} : BinNums.positive := match x with | BinNums.xI p => BinPosDef.Pos.add y (BinNums.xO (mul p y)) | BinNums.xO p => BinNums.xO (mul p y) | BinNums.xH => y end : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.mul (_ _)%positive_scope
BinIntDef.Z.mul = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.mul (_ _)%Z_scope
Inductive binary_le : nat -> nat -> Prop := in_ble_0 : forall n : nat, 0 ≲ n | in_ble_1 : forall n m : nat, rem n 2 <= rem m 2 -> div n 2 ≲ div m 2 -> n ≲ m Arguments binary_le (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments in_ble_0 _%nat_scope Arguments in_ble_1 (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.sqrt_up_wd = let H : Morphisms.Proper (eq ==> eq ==> eq) Nat.compare := fun (x x' : nat) (Hx : x = x') (y y' : nat) (Hy : y = y') => match Nat.compare_spec x y in (CompareSpec _ _ _ c) return (c = (x' ?= y')) with | CompEq _ _ x0 => match Nat.compare_spec x' y' in (CompareSpec _ _ _ c) return (x = y -> Eq = c) with | CompEq _ _ _ => fun _ : x = y => eq_refl | CompLt _ _ H => fun H0 : x = y => False_ind (Eq = Lt) ((fun Hx0 : y = x' => (fun Hy0 : x' = y' => (fun H1 : y' < y' => Nat.Private_OrderTac.Tac.lt_irrefl H1) (Nat.Private_OrderTac.Tac.eq_lt (Nat.Private_OrderTac.Tac.eq_sym Hy0) H)) (Nat.Private...
lb_pointwise = fun f : bool -> bool -> bool => fix lb_pointwise (l m : list bool) {struct l} : list bool := match l with | nil => match m with | nil => nil | _ :: _ => map (f false) m end | x :: l0 => match m with | nil => map (fun x0 : bool => f x0 false) l | y :: m0 => f x y :: lb_pointwise l0 m0 end end : (bool -> bool -> bool) -> list bool -> list bool -> list bool Arguments lb_pointwise _%function_scope (_ _)%list_scope
Inductive sig (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : Type := exist : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A | P x} Arguments sig [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments exist [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
binary_le_sind : forall P : nat -> nat -> SProp, (forall n : nat, P 0 n) -> (forall n m : nat, rem n 2 <= rem m 2 -> div n 2 ≲ div m 2 -> P (div n 2) (div m 2) -> P n m) -> forall n n0 : nat, n ≲ n0 -> P n n0
binary_le_ind : forall P : nat -> nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P 0 n) -> (forall n m : nat, rem n 2 <= rem m 2 -> div n 2 ≲ div m 2 -> P (div n 2) (div m 2) -> P n m) -> forall n n0 : nat, n ≲ n0 -> P n n0
Nat.log2_wd = fun (x x' : nat) (Hx : x = x') => let o : x <= 0 \/ 0 < x := Nat.le_gt_cases x 0 in match o with | or_introl H => (fun lemma : Nat.log2 x = 0 => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism Equivalence_Transitive (Nat.log2 x) 0 lemma (Nat.log2 x') (Nat.log2 x') (Morphisms.eq_proper_proxy (Nat.log2 x'))) (Nat.log2_nonpos x H) ((fun lemma : Nat.log2 x' = 0 => Morphisms.trans_sym_co_inv_impl_morphism (Equivalence_PER Nat.eq_equiv) (Nat.log2 x') 0 lemma) (Nat.log2_nonpos x' ((fun lemma : x = x' => Morphisms.subrelation_proper Nat.le_wd tt (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) Morph...
in_ble_1 : forall n m : nat, rem n 2 <= rem m 2 -> div n 2 ≲ div m 2 -> n ≲ m
exist : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A), P x -> {x : A | P x}
Nat.log2_up_wd = let H : Morphisms.Proper (eq ==> eq ==> eq) Nat.compare := fun (x y : nat) (H : x = y) (x0 y0 : nat) (H0 : x0 = y0) => match Nat.compare_spec x x0 in (CompareSpec _ _ _ c) return (c = (y ?= y0)) with | CompEq _ _ x1 => match Nat.compare_spec y y0 in (CompareSpec _ _ _ c) return (x = x0 -> Eq = c) with | CompEq _ _ _ => fun _ : x = x0 => eq_refl | CompLt _ _ H1 => fun H2 : x = x0 => False_ind (Eq = Lt) ((fun H3 : x0 = y => (fun H4 : y = y0 => (fun H5 : y0 < y0 => Nat.Private_OrderTac.Tac.lt_irrefl H5) (Nat.Private_OrderTac.Tac.eq_lt (Nat.Private_OrderTac.Tac.eq_sym H4)...
binary_le_inv : forall n m : nat, n ≲ m -> n = 0 \/ div n 2 ≲ div m 2 /\ rem n 2 <= rem m 2
BinPosDef.Pos.add = with add (x y : BinNums.positive) {struct x} : BinNums.positive := match x with | BinNums.xI p => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.xO (add_carry p q) | BinNums.xO q => BinNums.xI (add p q) | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xO (BinPosDef.Pos.succ p) end | BinNums.xO p => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.xI (add p q) | BinNums.xO q => BinNums.xO (add p q) | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xI p end | BinNums.xH => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.xO (BinPosDef.Pos.succ q) | BinNums.xO q => BinNums.xI q | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xO BinNums.x...
in_ble_0 : forall n : nat, 0 ≲ n
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
